examples: he was accredited with being one of the world's fastest sprinters

verb.description: (of an official body) give authority or sanction to (someone or something) when recognized standards have been met.
examples: institutions that do not meet the standards will not be accredited for teacher training
synonyms: put one's seal of approval on

verb.description: Give official authorization for (someone, typically a diplomat or journalist) to be in a particular place or to hold a particular post.
examples: an ambassador accredited to a northern European country

origin: Early 17th century (in accredit (sense 2)): from French accréditer, from a- (from Latin ad to, at) + crédit credit.
